thread.title: Hendrix stays in title race with victory over Chicago
thread.title_full: Hendrix stays in title race with victory over Chicago

author: David McCollum
title: Hendrix stays in title race with victory over Chicago
text:
Hendrix stays in title race with victory over Chicago   9:55pm By David McCollum LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
Hendrix’s defense gave fuel to the offense at key times Saturday afternoon, resulting in the Warriors’ 27-21 victory over the University of Chicago at Stagg Field in Chicago that kept them in the thick of the Southern Athletic Association race. 
The tipping point came midway through the fourth quarter when the Maroons, trailing 27-21, drove to the Hendrix 1, where they were stopped on downs. 
The Warriors then took the ball and ran out the final 8:15 on a 15-play, 74-yard drive, capped by a fourth-and-four pass from Seth Peters to Nate Hodapp that allowed Hendrix to run out the clock. 
Hendrix, which lost, 27-24, to league-leader Berry last week, upped its record to 5-2, 4-1 in conference. With its homecoming spoiled, Chicago fell to 5-2, 4-2. 
Peters and Dayton Winn led the Warriors to 597 yards in total offense. Peters, a junior from Greenbrier, completed 17 of 26 passes for 318 yards, three touchdowns and no interceptions. Winn ran 33 times for 197 yards and a touchdown. 
Chandler Marquardt stopped a fourth-quarter drive by the Maroons with an interception. Jake Brantley had 10 tackles with an interception. John Donald had eight tackles and Tyler Clifton added seven bills and a sack. Clifton and Brantley were both involved in the fourth-down stop on Chandler Carroll at the Hendrix 1 in the fourth quarter. 
The Warriors jumped to a 13-0 lead on a 54-yard pass from Peters to Ben Luedtke (8:07 first quarter) and a 14-yard pass from Peters to Ethan Hoppe with 1:27 left in the first. The drives were 85 yards in 12 plays and 64 yards in 12 plays, respectively 
After Chicago drew with 13-7 on a 43-yard pass from Burke Moser to Sam Coleman. 
Hendrix then drove 65 yards to Winn’s 3-yard run to take a 20-7 lead with 8:35 left in the half. 
A 20-yard pass from Chanlder to Nathan Massey drew the Maroons within 20-14 with 1:22 left in the third quarter. 
Early in the fourth quarter, Peters connected with Winn on a 74-yard touchdown pass to give the Warriors a 27-14 cushion with 13 seconds left in the third quarter. 
Carroll’s 9-yard run made it 27-21 with 13:29 left in the fourth quarter. 
The Warriors return home for the first time in three weeks Saturday for a Halloween night game against Rhodes.
